item.title: Faster-than-light neutrino result reportedly a mistake caused by loose cable
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:433926”][quote author=Frell link=topic=536643.msg3937886#msg3937886 date=1331172386]
they were fucking barbarians compared to now though
[/quote]

And people in the future will say exactly the same things about us. Point?[/quote]
Yes, they will say exactly the same about the Americans. Scientist nowadays make assumptions based on observable facts and have an exploratory mindset. People who said the earth was flat was just plain ignorant.

Read full topic

item.title: Faster-than-light neutrino result reportedly a mistake caused by loose cable
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“zachera, post:5, topic:433926”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=536643.msg3923783#msg3923783 date=1329985946]
What I find more annoying is that the normal media sees this as something that whipes Einstein’s theory off the table. If this were true, all it would mean is that at certain conditions the theory needs to be amended. If Einstein was wrong, we would have noticed by now.
[/quote]We wouldn’t have noticed given our limitation of technology up until this point.[/quote]

Exactly, people thought the world was flat at one point and that was considered a widely known fact, then it was proven wrong once enough evidence against it was found.

Read full topic
